Salary is less than corporate but benefits package evens this out.
No overtime!!
Less than 40 Hours weekly ( 37.5)

pros: Strong reputation, good work culture, excellent resources, smart people all around you, this is overall a nice place to work at.
cons: the university has a great bias towards computational departments and is not equally focussed on other disciplines - that makes interdisciplinary research difficult.

review_title: A great place for interdisciplinary research
pros: Living cost is low so the stipend is more than enough. The school really encourages interdisciplinary research. Very computer science focused which is good in the current era.
cons: Library does not have enough electrical resource. I need to ask friends at big universities to download papers for me. Pittsburgh offers little growth opportunities so some faculty members leave for other places.

review_title: Great place to learn, but don't stay too long
pros: The people that I worked with on research were absolutely brilliant. They also have access to everything you need as a researcher.
cons: There is almost no upward mobility and the raises often don't even keep up with inflation. Depending on your boss, the work/life balance can also be painful at times.

review_title: Great school, hard work, excellent people
pros: Secure position, great benefits, plenty of vacation time, passionate academics. Great place to work if you are planning to have kids and want to take advantage of tuition benefits, intend to get a masters degree, or are planning for retirement.
cons: Low pay, under-staffed, high stress environment. Difficult place for people just starting out in their careers. Fewer opportunities to advance and lower pay than in industry.

pros: Although there are different colleges within the university, people are always willing to assist you. There is a new structure to the HR department which I believe will be very helpful in assisting employees. Great resources available if you seek them out.
cons: Different colleges seem to have different salary structures even if you have the same title.  Hopefully there will be better alignment in the future

job_title: Assistant Administrative Aide in Pittsburgh, PA
pros: Relaxing, independent work environment. The office would go through very heavy work periods, and there always plenty to do. The professors themselves were respectful, and the administrative is very understanding of personal issues.
cons: Some days are slower than others, and the job requires a lot of phone calls and client interaction. Not a position meant for someone who does not like building personal relationships.

job_title: Senior Research Programmer in Pittsburgh, PA
pros:
* Work with genuinely smart people
* Challenging work problem
* Great work-life balance
cons:
* Virtually no career path
* Academic staff always have superior position than the research staff.  This is not only annoying but annoying when one tries to push project forward
* Learning of staff is not really encouraged

review_title: Great place to work if you're okay with beaurocracy
pros: Strong work/life balance, staff is engaged and in and proud of the CMU environment and reputation, ability to attract talented staff, strong focus professional development, nice campus.
cons: Typical academic beaurocracy - takes a long time to get anything done, career success is often greatly influenced by who you can schmooze.

pros: CMU encompasses a very intelligent and respectful environment. This extends for students, faculty and staff. Being part of the community has been wonderful. The employee benefits are generous, including comprehensive insurance and retirement packages.
cons: Salary at CMU is low compared to industry means. There are some caveats to how some of the advertised benefits can be utilized, including long vesting periods and taxable tuition remission.

job_title: Assistant Professor, Marketing in Pittsburgh, PA
pros: CMU is a research driven university and has a very open and collaborative culture. It is a birthplace for great, novel ideas. Teaching the smart students at CMU is a joy.
cons: Location in the city of Pittsburgh limits broad interactions with non-university entities.

pros: Really nice place with top world researchers very friendly and open for discussion. CMU is a place where you will learn a lot but also will inspire you with dozens of talks with people all around the world and access to  tones of information and contacts.
cons: Very competitive people, specially students. Researchers and professors are more relax.

review_title: There are lots of amazing resources, including people, with an emphasis on interdisciplinary work.
pros: Atypically interdisciplinary, a collaborative environment, as free of bureaucracy as one could hope.  The best management knows to empower, support and back away, which has been my experience.
cons: The city is great, but has a poor reputation, which occasionally causes recruiting to "settle" with applicants in the non-academic R&D space.

job_title: Undergraduate Teaching Assistant in Pittsburgh, PA
pros:
- Good salary
-Intellectual People
-Fun subject
-You learn more
- Helps me in my proposed field of career
-Good feedback
-overall great!
cons: I have nothing against Carnegie Mellon to say. Great college, great environment to work! Seriously could say nothing against this first best job!

pros: you learn a lot about the field that you conduct research in, professors are generally reasonable and willing to give out positions if you ask
cons: Pay is obviously not competitive, but the main goal of the experience is to gain more knowledge in the field you are working in

pros: Good amount of student employment within majors. Flexible scheduling an summer opportunities. Decent pay for student employment compared to other universities.
cons: Full time managers weren't always competent. Some departments needed more non student staff. Also didn't care much about student career development or job opportunities after college.

pros: Strong private research-oriented university. Pretty well-run in the social sciences. Good research-teaching balance. Solid compensation and benefits.
cons: Very decentralized and department-centric model, experience depends heavily on which department you land in and who leads it. Like all schools there is uncertainty about teaching and business model moving forward, though as a top private school the outlook is better than many I think.

review_title: Teaching Assistant under the Computer Science department.
pros: Although it really depends on which course you TA under, TA's are treated and generally paid well. Workload is not too heavy, and you can always let your professor know if you need a week off.
cons: TA-ing as a freshman results in really poor pay, considering that we do the same amount of work as the upperclassmen do.

review_title: Great, full of smartest people. You can always learn a lot from others.
pros: The weather is great, the class is perfect, everyone will like it.
cons: lots of students, feel crowded in the class, hard to find a quite place.

job_title: Research Associate III in Pittsburgh, PA
pros: Great community, great research.  I feel like I'm part of a great process to make the world a better place.
cons: Staff are really the bottom of the ladder.  My department treats staff rather poorly, taking them for granted and not appreciating them. Big emphasis on putting work above everything else in life to make last minute deadlines. Endemic stress culture.

review_title: Good Place to work for people who have family
pros:
The work is relatively not too fast in pace, but small issues are usually the one driving you nuts.
People are friendly, and nice to work with.
cons: Demanding in terms of work load

pros: You will love working at CMU. The automosphere of freedom opens your mind. You will meet lots of smart people here. CMU is most famous for its computer science. If you love tech, this is the paradise.
cons: There is really not much cons to say. It would be better if they could raise the compensation for PhD students a little bit.

pros: Benefits are awesome, 8% 401k contribution even if you don't contribute.
cons: Not enough cross training, too many employees that had all the knowledge for a position.  They in a sense held all the power because management couldn't afford to lose them.

pros: They have good professors and advisors who really know staff of their research fields. The environment is nice as you never feel those much pressure but you still keep learning new things and being productive.
cons: Several facilities are always busy, and kind of lack of staff. I wish there are more staff who can help students deal with advanced instruments.

pros: CMU offers excellent benefits, hours, and community, as well as professional development for people in any department. Its full of brilliant people, most of whom share a camaraderie.
cons: The quality of your work life is really up to your department and supervisors. Some people complain of sexism, and others of a culture of elitism and hierarchy.

review_title: a great place to work, while if you are all into research and stuff, very good CS programs and robotics
pros: the best reason to work at a university is of course its stability( well relatively I don;t really know what I' m trying to say actually
cons: could be a boring career compared to going to real industry and building something that actually makes money

review_title: Place full of smart and fun people
pros: As the title suggests, CMU has plethora of smart students and faculty. It easy to collaborate with others. Very good pay and benefits for PhD students.
cons: The courses at CMU are very intensive and time consuming. Although they are very comprehensive, but depending on the person everyone might not need to know everything about a field.

pros: I loved how I could work under Professors' supervision, who are one of the best in their area. Also, time management was flexible.
cons: It all really depends on who your supervisor is. Some people have too much work to study while working.

job_title: Senior Systems Administrator in Pittsburgh, PA
pros: CMU is a large employer that's not going anywhere. If you get a job here, you can expect to keep it for many years. It's also a comfortable, academic environment with lots of perks.
cons: As an academic institution, CMU's pay isn't quite as good as in the private sector. Some business processes aren't quite as mature as you'd find elsewhere.

review_title: Challenging, meaningful work in a supportive environment.
pros: Management was very clear in communicating background information and expectations. Very good work-life balance, with great advance notice when things got really busy. Provided the opportunity to work with very smart people on problems that really matter.
cons: I really can't find anything negative to say about my experience there.

pros:
Access to all of the CMU campus services like the gym and pool
Free tuition which covers up to two courses per semester
Pittsburgh is a safe, nice and cheap city to live
cons:
Salary is low compared to industry but that is to expect since it is academy
Research pressure can be very high as well as results depending on the supervisor

job_title: Graduate Research Assistant in Pittsburgh, PA
pros:
A great to work
Huge networking opportunity
A place to meet great minds
Very high alumni presence in different fields
cons: It would be better to expand into area like law and medicine, that way the community will be much more vibrant

pros: Strong culture of innovation and community. Access to facilities, tuition benefits, campus events. Good staff development programs offered every term.
cons: The salary for staff is low. Sometimes departments are understaffed and there is a lot of work to be done. There can be inertia in administration slowing down needed change.

review_title: Experience depends a lot of the research group
pros: International and well-known university in Pittsburgh. Staff is in general always friendly and helpful. Job depends to a very significant amount on research group and area.
cons: Professors can independently set up their own rules for research groups including working nearly 24h. There is nearly no control and protection for employees from the university management.

review_title: Only if they had family housing
pros: Good school, good department. Many faculty are motivated to do research as well as to teach. You also get to work with motivated, bright undergraduate students.
cons: The salary is not enough for someone who has a dependent. I wish there were school-subsidized housing for students who have family.

job_title: Graduate Research Assistant in Pittsburgh, PA
pros: People are generally nice and helpful, willing to spend time on helping the others, many programs are highly inter disciplinary and doing really interesting projects
cons: The campus is kind of small. There are not many food selections on campus, and some of them are not of good quality. Sometimes the sports facilities will get really crowded.

review_title: Basic pay, but plenty of opportunities
pros: All of the supervisors I had are great. They are understanding and can accommodate some of your requests. There are so many opportunities to work on campus. Almost every office here has openings. It's nice to have some extra income.
cons: The pay is pretty minimum. Also setting up the payroll is more complicated than necessary.

job_title: Graduate Teaching Assistant in Pittsburgh, PA
pros:
Regular pay raises for GTAs
Students are generally smart, responsible and easy to deal with
cons:
Experience may be better or worse depending on the department & particular supervisor
Some students are entitled and immature

review_title: Excellent pay while getting an education!
job_title: Housing Desk Attendant  in Pittsburgh, PA
pros: Great environment and accessible and rewarding location.  Availability for flexible hours
cons: Juggleing academics and work can be challenging at times.  Also,  those who are offcampus may find it slightly more challenging as all shifts must be completed on campus.

review_title: CMU has more than computer science
job_title: Graduate Research Assistant in Pittsburgh, PA
pros: Really good research and collaboration going on here.
cons: heavy load. Expect to work after hours.

job_title: Graduate Student Researcher in Pittsburgh, PA
pros: Great colleagues, professors and resources will make you motivate your research. You can enjoy many great seminars and talks from top researchers from CMU and also from all around the world. Pittsburgh is also a great town with good size town.
cons: winter is quite long and it's very cold. Apartments around the CMU are quite old.

review_title: Research Opportunities at CMU are a great choice
pros:
* Flexibility of hours and ability to work around courses
* Able to work on cutting edge research
* Paid or for units
* Can be done during the school year or over the summer
cons: * Can add to the work load of a given semester if you commit to too much work

job_title: Graduate Research Assistant in Pittsburgh, PA
pros: Being surrounded by intellectually exciting and passionate people all the time. Supportive and flexible work environment.There is always something to learn!
cons: Long hours - but there are rewarding if you love what you do. It is pretty much an academic bubble, in certain fields it is easy to lose touch with industry work.

job_title: Undergraduate Student Worker in Pittsburgh, PA
pros: Easy work, on campus so it was convenient to my academic schedule,  food when work was scheduled on lunch/dinner hours, breaks during the day where I could attend to my studies
cons: The starting hourly wage is low, only a little above minimum wage, it goes up a little as you stay longer though.

pros: Cmu is good to provide a very comfortable working laboratory. And it also have a very good professor.
cons: And I think actually, they should pay more salary for our work. Since they have so much money.

review_title: Great place to work and do research
job_title: Graduate Research Assistant in Pittsburgh, PA
pros: The environment here is very collaborative and supportive. Students are very hard working. A lot of resources offered by the university, and we get a large number of companies to come to campus for recruiting.
cons: Medical insurance for PhD students is not 100% covered.

pros: "My heart is in the work". You can meet smartest students and colleagues here. Also new techniques are emerging every second in CMU, waiting for you to explore.
cons: Too much work, not very good like-work balance, And the weather in Pittsburgh is not that good -- we have winter for six months of a year!

review_title: Work with a famous Carnegie Mellon Robot
pros: - Work with a famous (publications in media/papers) Carnegie Mellon University robot among the best robotics professors/post-docs/students
cons:
- Staying in Pittsburgh
- This is a slow academia research, people work on their papers and the focus is theory, not programming new robot actions

review_title: Carnegie Mellon University's Mellon College of Science is a a don't miss opportunity for growing your skills.
pros:
High impact work.  Opportunity to work with some of the best minds on the planet,   
High ethical standards. Multi-racial.  Multi-cultural.
cons: Large enough institution that the left hand didn't always know what the right was doing.

review_title: Good Workplace, but can be boring if in administration
pros:
- interactions good, smart people
- free food
cons: - interaction with secretaries are not the best (some are too snappy or rude

pros: Open group of smart people, people set high goals, very well known in the job market. The teaching is excellent and the funding is usually adequate.
